overview_of_class: Size, mass, & density of the earth, seismic waves; earth structure from seismology; minerals and rocks; composition of mantle and core; heat and temperature in the earth, radiometric age dating; origin of the elements, formation of the solar system; meteorites, formation of the planets; continents and oceans, paleomagnetism, continental drift; earthquake focal mechanisms, plate boundaries and kinematics, mechanics of plate tectonics.
name: Earth's Interior
title: WCAS EARTH 202-0-01 Earth's Interior
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-Req: Students must have taken MATH 224-0, [CHEM 101-0 or 171-0], AND [PHYSICS 125-1, 130-1, or 135-1], or obtain consent of instructor in order to register.

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Size, mass, & density of the earth, seismic waves; earth structure from seismology; minerals and rocks; composition of mantle and core; heat and temperature in the earth, radiometric age dating; origin of the elements, formation of the solar system; meteorites, formation of the planets; continents and oceans, paleomagnetism, continental drift; earthquake focal mechanisms, plate boundaries and kinematics, mechanics of plate tectonics.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Math 220 or 224, Chemistry 103, Physics 135-1 or equivalent, or permission of Instructor.
No seniors, EXCEPT for Senior Earth and Planetary Science Majors/Minors

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 1.5-hour lectures per week, One 1-hour lab section.

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value:
If you are unable to enroll for this class during your scheduled CAESAR registration time, you must complete the survey at this web address in order to be considered for enrollment: https://goo.gl/forms/PnAr1uUnwo4Ux7HG2 -

Additional seats MAY be offered to students who complete this survey - Enrollment decisions will be made before the first day of class. Priority enrollment will go to first-years and sophomores.
